story.text: HTML import is a tool to include [[HTML]] documents and web components from external sources without using ([[Ajax (programming)]]) requests - [https://www.w3.org/TR/html-imports/ w3.org]
The syntax for doing an HTML import looks like this:

</syntaxhighlight>To avoid loading and executing scripts twice that are introduced through imports, HTML import skips loading and executing files that have previously been loaded -
 [http://webcomponents.org/articles/introduction-to-html-imports/ webcomponents.org]

Mozilla Firefox ([[Firefox]]) has no support for HTML import and does not intend to implement it -
 [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Web_Components/HTML_Imports mozilla.org]
HTML Import is also related to an early idea in the development of hypertext called [[Transclusion]], where all or part of an document is inserted into another by reference.
